meanings.definition: relating to the process of digesting food
meanings.sent1: The digestive system helps our bodies break down food for energy.
meanings.sent2: She learned about the digestive process in science class.
meanings.sent3: The digestive cookies made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: His digestive abilities were as efficient as a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The digestive enzymes worked tirelessly to break down the meal.

meanings.definition: a substance that aids in digestion
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed a digestive to help with his stomach issues.
meanings.sent2: She always carries digestive tablets in her bag in case of indigestion.
meanings.sent3: The digestive tasted surprisingly good with the meal.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as a digestive, making the news easier to accept.
meanings.sent5: The herbal digestive provided relief after a heavy meal.

meanings.definition: a system in the body responsible for breaking down food
meanings.sent1: The digestive system includes the stomach and intestines.
meanings.sent2: He felt a sharp pain in his digestive after eating too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The digestive worked overtime after the big holiday feast.
meanings.sent4: Her digestive was like a well-coordinated team of workers.
meanings.sent5: The digestive efficiently processed the nutrients from the meal.
